conversations.content: What event coincides with the 3rd International Conference on the Holy Quds?

The event coincides with the birth anniversary of the Holy Prophet of Islam (peace be upon him and his immaculate household), in the year that has been designated by the Iranian nation as the 'Year of the Holy Prophet.'
Who does the speaker welcome to the conference?
The speaker welcomes dear guests, scholars, intellectuals, statesmen, those engaged in jihad in the way of Allah, and defenders of the ideological and jihadi frontiers of Islam.
What does the speaker describe as the worst catastrophe that has happened to the Islamic Ummah?

The speaker describes the occupation of Palestine and the Holy Quds as the worst catastrophe that has happened to the Islamic Ummah in the present era due to the plots and machinations of colonial powers.
What does the speaker hope the conference will inspire?

The speaker hopes the conference will inspire all participants with a spirit of striving in the way of Allah, unity, determination, and deep trust in divine promise, and, God willing, prepare the ground for the bestowal of divine mercy and victory.
What have the Palestinian people endured since the occupation?

The Palestinian people have endured hard times, ranging from desperate empty-handed resistance following the occupation, homelessness and displacement, witnessing the destruction of their homes and the massacre of their relatives and dear ones, seeking assistance from international organizations, and engaging in futile political deals and negotiations with the occupier.
What did the new generation of Palestinians achieve after the historic experiences of the occupation?
The new zealous generation of Palestinians reached the summit of awakening and broad-mindedness, leading to the eruption of the Intifada, a revolt against the oppression they had endured.
What actions did the opposing front take after the occupation of Palestine?

The opposing front took various actions such as merciless and unbridled ferocity, genocide, wrathful demolition, military aggression against neighbors, claims to territories from the Nile to the Euphrates, and political and economic encroachment on the region by exploiting the weakness and betrayal of certain politicians in the Islamic world.
What is the relationship between the United States and Britain with the Zionist regime, according to the speaker?

According to the speaker, the United States and Britain have provided money and might to support the Zionist criminals, and this support has been a key factor in the ruling of the usurper Zionist regime.
What crimes are being committed in Palestine, according to the speaker?

According to the speaker, the most heinous crimes in human history are being committed by alien and usurper Zionists against the oppressed owners of Palestinian territories, with the Zionist regime perpetrating brutal atrocities openly and boastfully.
What was the intention behind the Western politicians' plan for Palestine?
The Western politicians' intention behind the plan for Palestine was to ensure their long-term control and domination of Palestinian territories.
How does the speaker describe Palestine in the 1940s?

The speaker describes Palestine in the 1940s as a land in the heart of the Arab world, a poor country with a weak government and an unaware nation, surrounded by neighbors installed by colonial powers.
Who took control of Palestine from the Muslims in the 1940s?

The wealthiest and most evil Western government with the greatest stockpile of arms and weapons, provoked by the Zionists, took Palestine away from the Muslims and entrusted it to a racist, belligerent, and terrorist party supported by Western countries and both political blocs of the time.
Which regimes in the region supported the Zionist regime, according to the speaker?
The speaker mentions that puppet regimes in the region, including the Pahlavi regime in Iran and others that had turned their backs on Islam and Arab nations, supported the Zionist regime.
What kind of support did the Zionist regime receive from the United States and Europe?
The Zionist regime received money, weapons, science, and technology from the United States and Europe, with the United States acting as its guardian, attorney, and caterer.
How did the former Soviet Union view the issue of Palestine?
The former Soviet Union expressed no disagreement with the United States on the issue of Palestine, despite the fact that they were at odds on many other global issues.
What was the reaction of the Zionist regime to UN resolutions?
The Zionist regime utterly ignored the UN resolutions, even in their weak and conservative form.
Which countries did the Zionist regime launch military offensives against?
The Zionist regime launched military offensives against Egypt, Syria, Jordan, and Lebanon, and occupied parts of their territories with the intention of annexing them.
What kind of threats did the Zionist regime openly make?
The Zionist regime openly and audaciously made threats to assassinate, kill, and plunder.
Who were the leaders of the Zionist regime described as by the speaker?
The speaker describes the leaders of the Zionist regime as notorious terrorists who took power one after another, with the last one being referred to as the infamous butcher of 'Sabra and Shatila.'
What happened on the Palestinian front after initial weakness and failure?
After initial weakness and failure, various ideologies such as pan-Arabism, nationalism, and leftist views like Marxism were tested, but they all proved to be unsuccessful in practice.
What gradually brought hope and motivation to the Palestinian nation?

Religious faith, to which the Palestinian nation strongly adhered, gradually created some bright spots on the dark horizon, thanks to the firm determination of patient and persevering mujahedin, giving rise to hope and motivation.
What significant event occurred when the Islamic Revolution rose in the east?
When the sun of the 'Islamic Revolution' rose in the east, a divine revolution occurred, symbolized by a hoisted flag adorned with the words 'Allah,' 'the Islamic Sharia,' and 'Palestine.'
What process was initiated after the Islamic Revolution?

After the Islamic Revolution, the process of the downfall of the usurper regime and the decline in the absolute domination of the region by the United States, which had acted as an accomplice to the Zionist regime, was initiated.
What groups emerged in Palestine and Lebanon following the Islamic Revolution?
Jihadi groups devoted to Islam emerged in Palestine and Lebanon, forming a generation of dedicated and determined combatants.
How were jihad and martyrdom revitalized in Palestine and Lebanon?
Jihad and martyrdom were revitalized through the emergence of jihadi groups and the power of a nation intent on resistance and self-sacrifice.
What did the presence of devoted combatants and martyrdom-seeking youth achieve?

The presence of devoted combatants and martyrdom-seeking youth refuted all the calculations of materialistic mammonists pursuing riches and pleasure, opening a new arena in which blood achieved victory over the sword.
How has the rightful front changed over the past sixty years?

Over the past sixty years, the rightful front has grown stronger, becoming more vigorous and determined, while cherishing noble objectives. It is inspired with faith that appeals to new generations and continues to inflict military and political defeats on the enemy in Lebanon and Palestine, making steady progress towards a brilliant victory through its jihad.
What has Allah promised to those who believe and do good according to the Qur'an?

Allah has promised to those who believe and do good that He will make them rulers on the earth as He made rulers those before them. He will establish for them their religion, which He has chosen for them, and give them security in exchange for their fear. They will serve Him without associating others with Him. Those who disbelieve, on the other hand, are considered rebellious and wicked.
What problems is the unjust front currently facing?

The unjust front is currently facing schism, hesitation, and confusion. Its major patron, the United States, is confronting insolvable problems in the Middle East and faces increasing hatred from nations in the region and even globally. Their false hopes have diminished, and their ability to impose control is weakened.
What has the slogan of annexing territories from the Nile to the Euphrates been reduced to?
The slogan of annexing territories from the Nile to the Euphrates has been reduced to a slogan of maintaining security by building a wall around itself.
How has the use of tanks, bombs, assassinations, bulldozers, and prisons affected the Palestinian nation?

The use of tanks, bombs, assassinations, bulldozers, and prisons has only strengthened the Palestinian nation. These oppressive tools have turned the Palestinian people into 'tempered steel' and have made them more determined and perseverant. Despite the ongoing application of these methods, their impact continues to be counterproductive for the oppressors.
What are Muslim nations aspiring to attain?

Muslim nations are aspiring to attain freedom, honor, progress, and dignity under the banner of Islam. They are fed up with 200 years of domination by alien and colonial powers, as well as the imposed poverty, suffering, and backwardness that have resulted from this domination.
What key has been described as 'mysterious' in opening the doors of deliverance to the Muslim Ummah?

The key described as 'mysterious' in opening the doors of deliverance to the Muslim Ummah is the treatment of the issue of Palestine as the issue of all Muslim nations. This unity around Palestine is seen as a crucial factor in the Muslim Ummah's path to deliverance.
What has made the Palestinian people livelier, more valorous, and more efficient than their predecessors from sixty years ago?

The Palestinian people's faith, jihad, and the glorious Intifada have made them livelier, more valorous, and more efficient than their predecessors who lived some sixty years ago. Despite the pressures, injustice, and cruelty they have faced, these elements have strengthened their spirit and resilience.
What has the fifty-year effort of Britain, the United States, and Zionists to remove the word 'Palestine' from world maps resulted in?

The fifty-year effort of Britain, the United States, and Zionists to remove the word 'Palestine' from world maps and incorporate the Palestinian nation into other nations has proved futile. Instead of erasing the identity of the Palestinian people, their pressures, injustice, and cruelty have yielded contrary results, making the Palestinian people more lively, valorous, and efficient than before.
How is the jihad in Palestine described in relation to the Islamic world's jihad?

The jihad in Palestine is described as not only a cause for Palestine but as a major part of the Islamic world's jihad on vast fronts against aggressive, ruthless, and plunderous arrogant powers. It is viewed as a central struggle within the broader Islamic resistance against global oppression.
What kind of jihad does the text suggest is needed to achieve freedom from colonial domination in the Islamic world?

The text suggests that achieving freedom from colonial domination in the Islamic world requires a different kind of jihad: a scientific, political, and moral jihad. This form of jihad is necessary to liberate the Islamic world from domination, bullying, and intervention by colonial powers and to live under the banner of Islam.
What has been the role of Islamic Iran in the jihad of the Islamic world?

Islamic Iran has played a significant role in the jihad of the Islamic world by fostering and carrying into effect the principle of religious democracy. Over the past 27 years, Iran has been engaged in a sacred jihad based on faith, philanthropy, and scholarship. It has grown stronger and more progressive, and it continues to make steady progress through this form of jihad.
What is the main feature of the sacred jihad mentioned in the text?

The main feature of the sacred jihad mentioned in the text is that any firm step taken in this jihad strengthens the next step, making it firmer. The passing of any stage in this jihad makes it easier to pass the next stage, creating a continuous and reinforcing process of progress and resilience.
What is the main prerequisite for success in the jihad of Palestine and the jihad of the Islamic world?

The main prerequisite for success in the jihad of Palestine and the jihad of the Islamic world is the insistence on principles. The enemy is constantly trying to subvert Islamic principles, and if these principles are destroyed or diluted, Muslim nations will lose their guiding criteria and be subjected to the rules of the enemy. Maintaining Islamic principles is essential for the success of the jihad.
What happens when Muslims renounce their principles according to the text?

When Muslims renounce their principles, they lose their guiding criteria and become subjected to the rules defined by the enemy. As a result, they are at the mercy of the enemy's designs, which would ultimately lead to their subjugation and loss of identity.
What does the text say about those who recommend that Muslims relinquish their principles?

The text states that those who recommend Muslims relinquish their principles, whether due to negligence, avarice, or treachery, are individuals with a disease in their hearts. They do so out of fear that a calamity may befall them, but Allah may instead bring victory or punishment to expose what they have hidden in their souls, and they will regret their actions.
What has the United States and the West shown regarding those who are submissive to them?

The United States and the West have shown that they will not show mercy even to those who are submissive to them. They easily discard and do away with collaborators once they no longer need them, indicating that submission to the West offers no lasting benefit to those who comply with their demands.
What is the remark made by those who highlight the power of the enemy?

Those who highlight the power of the enemy warn truth-seekers and justice advocates against friction with the enemy. However, the text warns that their remark is dangerous and based on a paralogism. The real enemy is the one targeting an individual's identity, vital interests, and existence, and resistance against such an enemy is consistent with human wisdom.
What does submission to an enemy targeting one's identity and vital interests result in?

Submission to an enemy targeting one's identity, vital interests, and very existence results in unavoidable harm. This harm is equal to the damage that might come from confrontation with the enemy, plus the added humiliation and abasement that comes with submission.
Who is explicitly threatening the Islamic world today according to the text?

Today, global arrogance, whose spokesman is the incumbent U.S. president, is explicitly threatening the Islamic world. The arrogant Zionist network and the intelligence organizations of the United States and Britain are also fomenting conflict and disturbance across the Islamic world.
What is the recommendation given to Muslims regarding their identity?

Muslims are recommended to safeguard their identity and independence with full force. They should rely on the Qur'an and their faith in God and not allow fear to be instilled in them by the enemy. By upholding their identity and independence, Muslims can confront the threats and challenges posed by global arrogance.
What is the significance of the birth anniversary of the Holy Prophet of Islam mentioned in the speech?

The birth anniversary of the Holy Prophet of Islam is significant because it coincides with the conference and the year designated by the Iranian nation as the 'Year of the Holy Prophet'. This coincidence is meant to inspire all attendees with a spirit of striving in the way of Allah, unity, determination, and deep trust in divine promise, preparing the ground for the bestowal of divine mercy and victory.
What is the main purpose of the conference mentioned in the speech?

The main purpose of the conference is to exchange views and find a remedy for the occupation of Palestine and the Holy Quds, which is described as the worst catastrophe that has happened to the Islamic Ummah in the present era due to the plots and machinations of colonial powers.
What is the current era described as in the speech?

The current era is described as the era of Islamic awakening, with Palestine lying at the center of this awakening. This awakening has been ongoing for almost sixty years since the occupation of Palestine, during which the Palestinian people have endured various hardships and trials.
What are some of the trials and hardships endured by the Palestinian people mentioned in the speech?

The Palestinian people have endured desperate empty-handed resistance following the occupation, homelessness and displacement, witnessing the destruction of their homes and the massacre of their relatives and dear ones, seeking assistance from international organizations, engaging in futile political deals, and the gamble of negotiation with the occupier, which yielded nothing but a heavy loss.
What is the outcome of the historic experience of the Palestinian people mentioned in the speech?

The outcome of the historic experience of the Palestinian people helped the new zealous generation of this valorous nation to reach the summit of awakening and broad-mindedness and caused the volcano of the Intifada to erupt.
What steps were taken by the opposite front mentioned in the speech?

The opposite front took various steps ranging from merciless and unbridled ferocity, genocide and wrathful demolition, military aggression against neighbors and claims to the territories from the Nile to the Euphrates, to political and economic encroachment on the region by profiting from the weakness and betrayal on the part of certain politicians of the Islamic world.
What is the current state of the Zionist regime mentioned in the speech?

The Zionist regime is currently wavering and in despair, coming face to face with the sweeping wave of rising Islamic awakening. Despite committing heinous crimes and atrocities, the regime is experiencing a shift of power in Palestine and the Middle East.
What is the surprising reality revealed by the past sixty years mentioned in the speech?

The surprising reality revealed by the past sixty years is a great change on the scene and the shift of power from one front to the other both in Palestine and in the Middle East and the Islamic world. Western politicians had planned the tragedy of the usurpation of Palestine with the intention of ensuring their long-term control and domination of Palestinian territories.
What was the state of Palestine in the 1940s mentioned in the speech?

In the 1940s, Palestine was a land in the heart of the Arab world, a poor country with a weak government and an unaware nation, surrounded by neighbors installed by colonial powers. The wealthiest and most evil Western government, provoked by the Zionists, took it away from Muslims and entrusted it to a racist, belligerent and terrorist party which received support from all Western countries and from both of the world's two political blocs that were at odds with each other.
What role did the United States play in supporting the Zionist regime mentioned in the speech?

The United States acted as the guardian, attorney, and caterer for the Zionist regime, providing it with money, weapons, science, and technology. The United States also ignored UN resolutions and supported the Zionist regime in its military offensives on Egypt, Syria, Jordan, and Lebanon, occupying parts of their territories.
What were the various ideologies tested by the Palestinian nation mentioned in the speech?

The Palestinian nation tested various ideologies ranging from pan-Arabism and nationalism to leftist views such as Marxism, but all proved to be unsuccessful in practice. Religious faith, to which the Palestinian nation strongly adheres, gradually created bright spots on the dark and gloomy horizon and gave rise to hopes and motivation.
What was the impact of the Islamic Revolution on the Palestinian cause mentioned in the speech?

The Islamic Revolution in Iran, which was embellished with the words 'Allah', 'the Islamic Sharia' and 'Palestine', initiated the downfall of the usurper regime and decline in the absolute domination of the region by the United States. Jihadi groups devoted to Islam emerged in Palestine and Lebanon, revitalizing jihad and martyrdom and attaining genuine power.
What is the current state of the Palestinian front mentioned in the speech?

The Palestinian front is currently vigorous and determined, cherishing noble objectives and inspired with faith, which has strongly appealed to new generations. It is steadily getting stronger in the arena of Palestine, inflicting military and political defeats on the enemy in Lebanon and Palestine, and taking firm strides toward a brilliant victory through its epical jihad.
What is the state of the unjust front mentioned in the speech?

The unjust front is currently tormented with schism, hesitation, and confusion, following repeated retreats and losing its initial false hopes. Its major patron, the United States, is confronting insolvable problems in the Middle East and facing increasing hatred from nations of the region and the world.
What is the significance of Palestine to the Islamic world mentioned in the speech?

Palestine is significant to the Islamic world because it constitutes a major part of the Islamic world's jihad on vast fronts against aggressive, ruthless, plunderous arrogant powers. The Islamic world has experienced an awakening, and the slogan of the rule of Islam in all Islamic countries is the major slogan among the youth, academics, and intellectuals of these countries.
What is the impact of Western liberal democracy on the Islamic Ummah mentioned in the speech?

Western liberal democracy has hurt the body and soul of the Islamic Ummah and burned the hearts of Muslims. Iraq, Afghanistan, Lebanon, Guantanamo, AbuGhuraib, and other secret dungeons have shown the real meaning of 'liberty' and 'Western human rights'. Today, Western liberal democracy is as disgraced and detested in the Islamic world as was the East's socialism and communism yesterday.
What do Muslim nations aspire to according to the speech?

Muslim nations aspire to attain freedom, honor, progress, and dignity under the banner of Islam. They are fed up with the 200-year domination by alien and colonial powers and are tired of imposed poverty, suffering, and backwardness.
What is the duty of all Muslim nations regarding Palestine mentioned in the speech?

All Muslim nations should treat the issue of Palestine as their own issue. Palestine should return to the Palestinian nation, and a single Palestinian government, elected by all Palestinians, should administer the entire Palestinian territories. The fifty-year efforts of Britain and the United States and Zionists to remove the word 'Palestine' from world maps and incorporate the Palestinian nation into other nations have proved futile.
What is the divine promise mentioned in the speech?

The divine promise mentioned in the speech is that Allah has promised to those of you who believe and do good that He will most certainly make them rulers in the earth as He made rulers those before them, and that He will most certainly establish for them their religion which He has chosen for them, and that He will most certainly, after their fear, give them security in exchange; they shall serve Me, not associating aught with Me; and those who disbelieve henceforth, they are rebellious and wicked.
What kind of jihad is necessary for achieving freedom from domination in the Islamic world mentioned in the speech?

Achieving freedom from domination in the Islamic world is contingent on a jihad of a different kind, namely a scientific, political, and moral jihad. The Iranian nation has been engaged in this kind of jihad for the past 27 years and tasted its sweet results. The pillars of this sacred jihad are faith, philanthropy, and scholarship.
What is the main prerequisite for success in the jihad of Palestine and the Islamic world mentioned in the speech?

The main prerequisite for success in the jihad of Palestine and the Islamic world is insistence on principles. The enemy is always trying to subvert Islamic principles, and through deceits, promises, and threats, it is demanding that Muslims renounce their principles. If their principles are destroyed or diluted, Muslim nations will lose their guiding criteria and be subjected to the rules defined by the enemy.
What is the danger of exaggerating the power of the enemy mentioned in the speech?

Exaggerating the power of the enemy is one of the stratagems used by the enemy. Money, political and military force, and modern stockpiled weapons will scare those governments that are deprived of popular support. The military overpowering of a regime such as that of Saddam, who did not enjoy public support and whose army had no sense of faith and jihad, is not proof of power. The United States has not been able to overcome the Iraqi nation.
What is the significance of the chain of U.S. plots against Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Lebanon mentioned in the speech?

The chain of U.S. plots against Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Lebanon is aimed at preparing the way for U.S. domination of the Middle East, with the Zionist regime holding supremacy in the region. However, these plots will never succeed and will yield nothing but fatal damage to U.S. politicians.
What should the U.S. administration do according to the speech?

The U.S. administration should forgo its stubbornness and grudge against the Iraqi nation and submit to that nation's vote in favor of its elected government, respect the government elected by the Palestinian nation, rein in its rogue and villainous ally the usurper Zionist regime, immediately release the oppressed inmates who are locked up in Guantanamo, AbuGhuraib and its other secret prisons, stop hatching plots against Syria, Lebanon, and the Islamic Republic of Iran, and not create tension in the sensitive Middle East region and the Persian Gulf through its ignorance.
What message does the speaker have for the Palestinian people at the end of the speech?

The speaker tells the valorous, steadfast Palestinian people that they have brought honor to the Islamic world through their jihad, patience, and brilliant resistance and become a model nation. Their heavy load of great sufferings has not bent their backs, and the immaculate blood of their martyrs has deepened their firm determination and perseverance. Their enemy, despite its brutality and bloodthirstiness, has not been able to push them back, and today they are stronger than ever. The blood of great martyrs has so far prevailed over the enemy's sword, and from now on also, by divine power, it will achieve greater victories.
What is the significance of the divine promise mentioned at the end of the speech?

The divine promise mentioned at the end of the speech is that Allah has assured the ultimate victory of believers and perseverant mujahedin. The speaker quotes the Qur'an: 'And the word of your Lord has been accomplished truly and justly; there is none who can change His words, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.' This assures the Palestinian people that their agonizing pains and hardships will be remunerated by Almighty Allah.
What is the significance of the birth anniversary of the Holy Prophet of Islam mentioned in the speech?

The birth anniversary of the Holy Prophet of Islam is significant because it coincides with the conference and the year designated by the Iranian nation as the 'Year of the Holy Prophet'. This coincidence is meant to inspire all attendees with a spirit of striving in the way of Allah, unity, determination, and deep trust in divine promise, preparing the ground for the bestowal of divine mercy and victory.

What is the outcome of the historic experience of the Palestinian people mentioned in the speech?

The outcome of the historic experience of the Palestinian people helped the new zealous generation of this valorous nation to reach the summit of awakening and broad-mindedness and caused the volcano of the Intifada to erupt.

What is the current state of the Zionist regime mentioned in the speech?

What is the surprising reality revealed by the past sixty years mentioned in the speech?

What was the state of Palestine in the 1940s mentioned in the speech?

What role did the United States play in supporting the Zionist regime mentioned in the speech?

The United States acted as the guardian, attorney, and caterer for the Zionist regime, providing it with money, weapons, science, and technology. What were the various ideologies tested by the Palestinian nation mentioned in the speech?

What was the impact of the Islamic Revolution on the Palestinian cause mentioned in the speech?

The Islamic Revolution in Iran, which was embellished with the words 'Allah', 'the Islamic Sharia' and 'Palestine', initiated the downfall of the usurper regime and decline in the absolute domination of the region by the United States. What is the current state of the Palestinian front mentioned in the speech?

The Palestinian front is currently vigorous and determined, cherishing noble objectives and inspired with faith, which has strongly appealed to new generations. What is the state of the unjust front mentioned in the speech?

The unjust front is currently tormented with schism, hesitation, and confusion, following repeated retreats and losing its initial false hopes. What is the significance of Palestine to the Islamic world mentioned in the speech?

Palestine is significant to the Islamic world because it constitutes a major part of the Islamic world's jihad on vast fronts against aggressive, ruthless, plunderous arrogant powers. What do Muslim nations aspire to according to the speech?

All Muslim nations should treat the issue of Palestine as their own issue. Palestine should return to the Palestinian nation, and a single Palestinian government, elected by all Palestinians, should administer the entire Palestinian territories. The opposite front took various steps ranging from merciless and unbridled ferocity, genocide and wrathful demolition, military aggression against neighbors and claims to the territories from the Nile to the Euphrates, to political and economic encroachment on the region by profiting from the weakness and betrayal on the part of certain politicians of the Islamic world.
What is the current state of the Zionist regime mentioned in the speech?

The Zionist regime is currently wavering and in despair, coming face to face with the sweeping wave of rising Islamic awakening. Despite committing heinous crimes and atrocities, the regime is experiencing a shift of power in Palestine and the Middle East.
What is the surprising reality revealed by the past sixty years mentioned in the speech?

The surprising reality revealed by the past sixty years is a great change on the scene and the shift of power from one front to the other both in Palestine and in the Middle East and the Islamic world. Western politicians had planned the tragedy of the usurpation of Palestine with the intention of ensuring their long-term control and domination of Palestinian territories.
What was the state of Palestine in the 1940s mentioned in the speech?

In the 1940s, Palestine was a land in the heart of the Arab world, a poor country with a weak government and an unaware nation, surrounded by neighbors installed by colonial powers. The wealthiest and most evil Western government, provoked by the Zionists, took it away from Muslims and entrusted it to a racist, belligerent and terrorist party which received support from all Western countries and from both of the world's two political blocs that were at odds with each other.
What role did the United States play in supporting the Zionist regime mentioned in the speech?

The United States acted as the guardian, attorney, and caterer for the Zionist regime, providing it with money, weapons, science, and technology. The United States also ignored UN resolutions and supported the Zionist regime in its military offensives on Egypt, Syria, Jordan, and Lebanon, occupying parts of their territories.
What were the various ideologies tested by the Palestinian nation mentioned in the speech?

The Palestinian nation tested various ideologies ranging from pan-Arabism and nationalism to leftist views such as Marxism, but all proved to be unsuccessful in practice. Religious faith, to which the Palestinian nation strongly adheres, gradually created bright spots on the dark and gloomy horizon and gave rise to hopes and motivation.
What was the impact of the Islamic Revolution on the Palestinian cause mentioned in the speech?

The Islamic Revolution in Iran, which was embellished with the words 'Allah', 'the Islamic Sharia' and 'Palestine', initiated the downfall of the usurper regime and decline in the absolute domination of the region by the United States. Jihadi groups devoted to Islam emerged in Palestine and Lebanon, revitalizing jihad and martyrdom and attaining genuine power.
What is the current state of the Palestinian front mentioned in the speech?

The Palestinian front is currently vigorous and determined, cherishing noble objectives and inspired with faith, which has strongly appealed to new generations. It is steadily getting stronger in the arena of Palestine, inflicting military and political defeats on the enemy in Lebanon and Palestine, and taking firm strides toward a brilliant victory through its epical jihad.
What is the state of the unjust front mentioned in the speech?

The unjust front is currently tormented with schism, hesitation, and confusion, following repeated retreats and losing its initial false hopes. Its major patron, the United States, is confronting insolvable problems in the Middle East and facing increasing hatred from nations of the region and the world.
What is the significance of Palestine to the Islamic world mentioned in the speech?

Palestine is significant to the Islamic world because it constitutes a major part of the Islamic world's jihad on vast fronts against aggressive, ruthless, plunderous arrogant powers. The Islamic world has experienced an awakening, and the slogan of the rule of Islam in all Islamic countries is the major slogan among the youth, academics, and intellectuals of these countries.
What is the impact of Western liberal democracy on the Islamic Ummah mentioned in the speech?

Western liberal democracy has hurt the body and soul of the Islamic Ummah and burned the hearts of Muslims. Iraq, Afghanistan, Lebanon, Guantanamo, AbuGhuraib, and other secret dungeons have shown the real meaning of 'liberty' and 'Western human rights'. Today, Western liberal democracy is as disgraced and detested in the Islamic world as was the East's socialism and communism yesterday.
What do Muslim nations aspire to according to the speech?

Muslim nations aspire to attain freedom, honor, progress, and dignity under the banner of Islam. They are fed up with the 200-year domination by alien and colonial powers and are tired of imposed poverty, suffering, and backwardness.
What is the duty of all Muslim nations regarding Palestine mentioned in the speech?

All Muslim nations should treat the issue of Palestine as their own issue. Palestine should return to the Palestinian nation, and a single Palestinian government, elected by all Palestinians, should administer the entire Palestinian territories. The fifty-year efforts of Britain and the United States and Zionists to remove the word 'Palestine' from world maps and incorporate the Palestinian nation into other nations have proved futile.
What is the divine promise mentioned in the speech?

The divine promise mentioned in the speech is that Allah has promised to those of you who believe and do good that He will most certainly make them rulers in the earth as He made rulers those before them, and that He will most certainly establish for them their religion which He has chosen for them, and that He will most certainly, after their fear, give them security in exchange; they shall serve Me, not associating aught with Me; and those who disbelieve henceforth, they are rebellious and wicked.
What kind of jihad is necessary for achieving freedom from domination in the Islamic world mentioned in the speech?

Achieving freedom from domination in the Islamic world is contingent on a jihad of a different kind, namely a scientific, political, and moral jihad. The Iranian nation has been engaged in this kind of jihad for the past 27 years and tasted its sweet results. The pillars of this sacred jihad are faith, philanthropy, and scholarship.
What is the main prerequisite for success in the jihad of Palestine and the Islamic world mentioned in the speech?

The main prerequisite for success in the jihad of Palestine and the Islamic world is insistence on principles. The enemy is always trying to subvert Islamic principles, and through deceits, promises, and threats, it is demanding that Muslims renounce their principles. If their principles are destroyed or diluted, Muslim nations will lose their guiding criteria and be subjected to the rules defined by the enemy.
What is the danger of exaggerating the power of the enemy mentioned in the speech?

Exaggerating the power of the enemy is one of the stratagems used by the enemy. Money, political and military force, and modern stockpiled weapons will scare those governments that are deprived of popular support. The military overpowering of a regime such as that of Saddam, who did not enjoy public support and whose army had no sense of faith and jihad, is not proof of power. The United States has not been able to overcome the Iraqi nation.
What is the significance of the chain of U.S. plots against Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Lebanon mentioned in the speech?

The chain of U.S. plots against Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Lebanon is aimed at preparing the way for U.S. domination of the Middle East, with the Zionist regime holding supremacy in the region. However, these plots will never succeed and will yield nothing but fatal damage to U.S. politicians.
What should the U.S. administration do according to the speech?

The U.S. administration should forgo its stubbornness and grudge against the Iraqi nation and submit to that nation's vote in favor of its elected government, respect the government elected by the Palestinian nation, rein in its rogue and villainous ally the usurper Zionist regime, immediately release the oppressed inmates who are locked up in Guantanamo, AbuGhuraib and its other secret prisons, stop hatching plots against Syria, Lebanon, and the Islamic Republic of Iran, and not create tension in the sensitive Middle East region and the Persian Gulf through its ignorance.
What message does the speaker have for the Palestinian people at the end of the speech?

The speaker tells the valorous, steadfast Palestinian people that they have brought honor to the Islamic world through their jihad, patience, and brilliant resistance and become a model nation. Their heavy load of great sufferings has not bent their backs, and the immaculate blood of their martyrs has deepened their firm determination and perseverance. Their enemy, despite its brutality and bloodthirstiness, has not been able to push them back, and today they are stronger than ever. The blood of great martyrs has so far prevailed over the enemy's sword, and from now on also, by divine power, it will achieve greater victories.
What is the significance of the divine promise mentioned at the end of the speech?

The divine promise mentioned at the end of the speech is that Allah has assured the ultimate victory of believers and perseverant mujahedin. The speaker quotes the Qur'an: 'And the word of your Lord has been accomplished truly and justly; there is none who can change His words, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.' This assures the Palestinian people that their agonizing pains and hardships will be remunerated by Almighty Allah.
What is the significance of the birth anniversary of the Holy Prophet of Islam mentioned in the speech?

The birth anniversary of the Holy Prophet of Islam is significant because it coincides with the conference and the year designated by the Iranian nation as the 'Year of the Holy Prophet'. This coincidence is meant to inspire all attendees with a spirit of striving in the way of Allah, unity, determination, and deep trust in divine promise, preparing the ground for the bestowal of divine mercy and victory.
What is the main purpose of the conference mentioned in the speech?

The main purpose of the conference is to exchange views and find a remedy for the occupation of Palestine and the Holy Quds, which is described as the worst catastrophe that has happened to the Islamic Ummah in the present era due to the plots and machinations of colonial powers.
What is the current era described as in the speech?

The current era is described as the era of Islamic awakening, with Palestine lying at the center of this awakening. This awakening has been ongoing for almost sixty years since the occupation of Palestine, during which the Palestinian people have endured various hardships and trials.
What are some of the trials and hardships endured by the Palestinian people mentioned in the speech?

The Palestinian people have endured desperate empty-handed resistance following the occupation, homelessness and displacement, witnessing the destruction of their homes and the massacre of their relatives and dear ones, seeking assistance from international organizations, engaging in futile political deals, and the gamble of negotiation with the occupier, which yielded nothing but a heavy loss.
